Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 45.0) and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Extrude the 3D sketch to a depth of 0.0089 units towards the normal, and 0.0 units in the opposite direction of the normal. The sketch scale is 0.75, and the operation is to create a new solid body. The length of this part is 0.75 units, the width is also 0.75 units, and the height is 0.0089 units. With this, we have completed the construction of Part 1. Proceed to the next part, following the same detailed step-by-step instructions.</description>
